For example, 5 and 9, as well as 2 and 4, have the same parity, while 6 and 9 do not.\n*/\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    string getSmallestString(string s) {\n        int sz = s.length();\n       // double ans = stod(s);\n        string  res_s = s;\n        int diff_max = 0;\n        for(int i=0; i<sz-1; i++) {\n            if((s[i]+s[i+1]) % 2 == 0 ) {\n                string new_s = s;\n                new_s[i] = s[i+1];\n                new_s[i+1] = s[i];\n                int diff = s[i] - s[i+1];\n               //double new_ans = stod(new_s);\n                if( diff > 0 ) {\n                     diff_max = diff;\n                     return new_s; \n                };\n            }\n        }\n        return res_s;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"lexicographically-smallest-string-after-a-swap","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
